meanings.sent1: The new law was enforceable, meaning it could be enforced by the authorities.
meanings.sent2: The contract was enforceable, ensuring both parties would follow its terms.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog was as enforceable as a flying pig.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as enforceable as a steel chain.
meanings.sent5: The image of the towering mountain was enforceable in his mind, unforgettable and solid.

meanings.sent1: The rules were enforceable, making sure everyone followed them.
meanings.sent2: The regulations were enforceable, keeping order in the community.
meanings.sent3: The concept of a silent opera was as enforceable as a singing fish.
meanings.sent4: His will to win was as enforceable as a locked door.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of loneliness was enforceable in the empty room, suffocating and real.

meanings.sent1: The policies were enforceable, ensuring compliance from all employees.
meanings.sent2: The guidelines were enforceable, maintaining a fair environment.
meanings.sent3: The notion of a square circle was as enforceable as a melting snowman.
meanings.sent4: Their bond was as enforceable as a contract signed in blood.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers was enforceable in the garden, fragrant and undeniable.
